tasks.task: Tending to Garlic and Onion Plants
subtasks: Identify garlic plants to top (cut the flowers/blooms)
Allow onions with flowers to be pulled immediately
Wait until natural stalk fall for onions not yet flowering
Harvest onions on a hot, dry, sunny day
Leave onion stalks on after pulling
Cure onions in a cool, dry place for 2-3 weeks
Cut onion stalks about 1-2 inches above the bulb post-cure
Store healthy onions, separating damaged or diseased ones
Infuse the garden soil with Deetermine to manage weeds
Apply controlling agents for soil-borne diseases
Monitor plant growth and remove flowers from onions as needed
Dispose of pulled onions properly (e.g., composting or waste)
